title: Sport
summary: Vocabulary related to sports, including people involved, sports facilities, and common verbs and phrases used to describe sporting actions and events, with clear definitions and example sentences.

sections.heading: People in Sport
sections.content: Key vocabulary for describing people involved in sports events.

examples.definition: The people who watch a sports event.
examples.example: The crowd cheered loudly when the team scored a goal.

examples.definition: People who enthusiastically follow and support a sport, team, or player.
examples.example: Thousands of fans gathered in the city to celebrate their victory.

examples.definition: Individuals who participate in a sports game or event.
examples.example: The players shook hands after the match as a sign of sportsmanship.

examples.definition: A group of players working together in a sport.
examples.example: The team practiced every evening for their big game.

examples.definition: The player who guards the goal in sports like football and hockey.
examples.example: The goalkeeper made an amazing save during the final minutes of the match.

examples.definition: The person who trains and directs the team.
examples.example: The coach gave a motivational talk to the players at halftime.

examples.definition: An official who enforces the rules in sports such as football, basketball, and boxing.
examples.example: The referee blew the whistle to signal the end of the match.

examples.definition: An official who enforces the rules in sports such as tennis, baseball, and cricket.
examples.example: The umpire shouted, 'Out!'

examples.definition: An official who helps the main referee by indicating when the ball is out of play or when players are offside.
examples.example: The linesman raised his flag to indicate an offside.

sections.heading: Sports Facilities and Places
sections.content: Vocabulary for describing where sports are played.

examples.definition: A large structure with seats for spectators, where sports events are held.
examples.example: The stadium was filled with excited fans for the championship game.

examples.definition: The area of ground where sports like football, cricket, or hockey are played.
examples.example: The football players ran onto the pitch as the game began.

examples.definition: A playing area for sports like basketball, volleyball, or tennis.
examples.example: The players entered the tennis court for the final match.

examples.definition: The area where golf is played.
examples.example: The golfers walked across the course to the next hole.

examples.definition: A building or room designed for indoor sports and physical education.
examples.example: The students gathered in the sports hall for the basketball tournament.

examples.definition: A circular or oval path for running, cycling, or motor racing.
examples.example: The runners lined up on the track for the 100-meter race.

examples.definition: A marked path on a mountain for skiing.
examples.example: Skiers enjoyed going down the amazing ski pistes.

sections.heading: Verbs for Talking About Sport
sections.content: Common verbs and phrases used to describe actions and events in sports.

examples.definition: To be better than your opponents in a match or competition.
examples.example: When she won the race, her team celebrated their victory.

examples.definition: To perform better than someone in a game or contest.
examples.example: He beat his opponent in the final set of the tennis match.

examples.definition: When two teams or players have the same score at the end of a game.
examples.example: England and Italy drew one-one.

examples.definition: To achieve a better score or time than ever before.
examples.example: She broke the record for the fastest 100-meter sprint.

examples.definition: To maintain the best score or time until someone else breaks it.
examples.example: The swimmer has held the world record for the 200-meter freestyle for three years.

examples.definition: To gain goals, points, or baskets.
examples.example: He scored the winning goal in the last minute of the game.

examples.definition: To hurt yourself while playing or practicing a sport.
examples.example: She got injured during the football match and had to leave the field.

examples.definition: To do exercises to prepare for physical activity.
examples.example: Before the race, the runners warm up to avoid injuries.

examples.definition: To improve your physical condition through exercise and healthy living.
examples.example: He started jogging every day to get fit.

examples.definition: To be made to leave the game as a penalty for breaking the rules.
examples.example: The player was sent off for arguing with the referee.

examples.definition: To propel a ball with your hand or arm.
examples.example: The quarterback threw the football to his teammate.

examples.definition: To make contact with a ball using a bat, racket, or similar.
examples.example: She hit the tennis ball across the court.

examples.definition: To send the ball to a teammate.
examples.example: He passed the basketball to his teammate, who was open for a shot.

examples.definition: To strike a ball with your foot.
examples.example: The soccer player kicked the ball towards the goal.

examples.definition: To hit the ball with your head.
examples.example: The player headed the ball into the goal from the corner kick.

examples.definition: To stop and hold a ball that has been thrown, kicked, or hit.
examples.example: The baseball player caught the ball, and the batter was out.
